trans-unit.source: Represents the result returned by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule"></xref>.<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate*> method that indicates whether the checked value passed the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule"></xref>.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] data binding model enables you to associate <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.ValidationRules%2A> with your <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object.
You can create custom rules by subclassing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule> class and implementing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate%2A> method returns a ValidationResult object to report whether the checked value is valid.
For a detailed discussion of the validation process, see "Data Validation" in [Data Binding Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref> class.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] data binding model enables you to associate <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.ValidationRules%2A> with your <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object.
You can create custom rules by subclassing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule> class and implementing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult> object to report whether the checked value is valid.
For a detailed discussion of the validation process, see "Data Validation" in [Data Binding Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Whether or not the value checked against the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule"></xref> is valid.
Information about the invalidity.
Compares the specified instance and the current instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref> for value equality.
This method is called by the operator overrides.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref> instance to compare.
if obj and this instance of .have the same values.
Gets an object that provides additional information about the invalidity.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] data binding model enables you to associate <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.ValidationRules%2A> with your <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object.
You can create custom rules by subclassing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule> class and implementing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult> object to report whether the checked value is valid.
For a detailed discussion of the validation process, see "Data Validation" in [Data Binding Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An object that provides additional information about the invalidity.
Returns the hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref>.
The hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the value checked against the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule"></xref> is valid.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] data binding model enables you to associate <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.ValidationRules%2A> with your <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object.
You can create custom rules by subclassing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule> class and implementing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.Validate%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult> object to report whether the checked value is valid.
For a detailed discussion of the validation process, see "Data Validation" in [Data Binding Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the value is valid; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref> objects for value equality.
The first instance to compare.
The second instance to compare.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the two objects are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref> objects for value inequality.
The first instance to compare.
The second instance to compare.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the values are not equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a valid instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref>.
A valid instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationResult"></xref>.
